results.title: Midnight express [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, David Puttnam and Casablanca Films
results.brief_description: A young tourist, Billy Hayes (Brad Davis), travelling in Turkey is arrested for possession of hashish. The film traces his experiences, often violent and terrifying, in a foreign jail and his attempts to escape and cross the border into freedom. The cast also features John Hurt and Randy Quaid with a script by Oliver Stone. The film is based on Billy Hughes’ book of the same title relating his jail experiences.

results.title: The Thing [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, David Foster, Lawrence Turman, Turman-Foster Company and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A new version of the classic horror thriller starring Kurt Russell. It is set in the winter of 1982 at a research station in Antarctica where a twelve man research team finds an alien being that has fallen from the sky and has remained buried in the snow for over 100,000 years. Soon, it is unfrozen and unleashed, creating havoc and terror as it changes forms and becomes one of them. A frightening story with outstanding performances, incredible special effects by Roy Arbogast, make up by Rob Bottin and special visual effects by master Albert Whitlock. Based on the story “Who goes there?” by John W. Campbell, Jr.

results.title: Taxi driver [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Julia Phillips, Michael Phillips and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Robert de Niro plays Travis Bickle, a Vietnam veteran who takes up driving a cab at night in New York City. The job brings him into contact with what he calls the “scum and sewerage, the pimps and pushers” of the city. He attempts to find redemption through love, first for the politically ambitious and sophisticated Betsy (Cybill Shepherd), and, when he is rejected, by rescuing a 12 year old prostitute (Jodie Foster) from her pimp. When love fails Travis, he is provoked into an act of savage violence as his judgement on the world. The film is infamous for having influenced American President Reagan’s would-be assassin John Hinkley, but it is more significant for portraying the paralyzing decay and resultant psycho-pathology of American urban life. Scripted by Paul Schrader, “Taxi Driver” is one of Scorsese’s masterworks. Cast also includes Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Run Lola run = Lola Rennt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tom Tykwer, Stefan Arndt, Arte, Bavaria Film, BMI, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, German Independents, NRW, WDR and X filme creative Pool
results.brief_description: Time is running out for Lola (Franka Potente). She’s just received a frantic phone call from her boyfriend Manni (Moritz Bleibtreu), who’s lost a small fortune in cash belonging to his Mob boss. Now she has to run for his life, to try and come up with the money before Manni pays the ultimate price for his mistake. Using a destiny device, the story begins anew with different outcomes. Other cinematic techniques which add to the breakneck pace and excitement of this innovative thriller include jump cuts, whip pans, slow and fast motion, split-screen, intercut colour and black and white, segment titles and animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Tykwer, Stefan Arndt, Arte, Bavaria Film, BMI, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, German Independents, NRW, WDR and X filme creative Pool

results.title: Godzilla
results.creator_credit: Roland Emmerich, Dean Devlin and Centropolis Pictures
results.brief_description: Perhaps one of the world’s most famous and enduring characters, Godzilla first appeared on Japanese screens in the 1954 release “Gojira”. In this version, the monster lizard has been created on a remote island somewhere in the South Pacific by nuclear testing, and she is heading to America, land of plenty, to hatch her offspring. Fantastic special effects make this the ultimate monster movie - a 20 story tall lizard with one thing on her mind.

results.title: Sleepy Hollow
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Adam Schroeder, Scott Rudin, American Zoetrope, Mandalay Pictures and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Washington Irving’s classic tale of Ichabod Crane and the Headless Horseman is given a few new twists in the hands of director Tim Burton. Ichabod Crane (Johnny Depp) is a New York City detective whose unorthodox techniques and penchant for gadgets makes him unpopular with his colleagues. He is sent to the remote town of Sleepy Hollow to investigate a series of bizarre murders, in which a number of people have been found dead in the woods with their heads cut off. Crane refuses to believe the local legend that the ghost of a sadistic Hessian soldier rides through the woods on horseback, lopping off the heads of the unbelieving and is convinced there is a logical explanation. This disturbing tale of suspense, murder and mysticism also stars Christina Ricci, Miranda Richardson, Christopher Lee and Christopher Walken.

results.title: Jaws [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, David Brown, Richard Zanuck and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A killer great white shark is creating havoc at a Long Island Beach. Facing opposition and denial from the town’s Council, the Police Chief (Roy Scheider) decides to search for, and destroy, the killer shark himself. Based on Peter Benchley’s novel, the film grabs audience attention from its opening scene to the closing credits and the suspense and terror never lets up. Skilfully edited and directed, the film set director Spielberg onto the path of fame and fortune. “Jaws” is a consummate cinematic thriller. With Richard Dreyfuss and Robert Shaw. The chilling score is by John Williams.

results.title: The Time of your life
results.creator_credit: H C Potter, William Cagney and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film is more than just a comedy - it was a labour of love for James Cagney and his brother, producer, William Cagney. Set in a waterfront saloon in San Francisco, the film has a warm and engaging atmosphere about it. It is entirely ‘laid back” - indeed Cagney remains seated for most of the picture. Joe (Cagney) is a philosophical souse who encourages all those around him to indulge in their wildest dreams. Joe’s pal Tom (Wayne Morris), a born patsy, runs errands for Joe, the only person who has ever shown him kindness. Kitty (Jeanne Cagney), a streetwalker, willingly allows Joe to sponge drinks off her in exchange for a few kind words. Harry (Paul Draper), an enthusiastic but hopelessly untalented dancer-comedian, is hired by bartender Nick (William Bendix) at Joe’s urging. And Kit Carson (James Barton), an addled old man who lives in a dream world, is prodded by Joe into weaving his unlikely reminisces of the Wild West. Based on the whimsical play by William Saroyan.

results.title: The Craic
results.creator_credit: Ted Emery, David Foster, Jimeoin McKeown, Marc Gracie, Australian Film Commission, Crack Pty Ltd, Foster Gracie and Geffer Notice
results.brief_description: Craic is Irish slang for a laugh or a good time, which is what this comedy about two Irishmen on the run in Australia is all about. Fergus (Jimeoin) and his best friend Wesley (Alan McKee) are living in Belfast when they incur the wrath of violent IRA leader, Colin (Robert Morgan). Since Ireland no longer seems like a safe place to stay, they head for Sydney, where they manage to find work despite not having the necessary work permits. Fergus gets a chance to appear on TVs “The Dating Game” and wins a vacation to Queensland. However immigration authorities become aware of the friends’ illegal status and Wesley tracks down Fergus, just in time to meet up with Colin who has come to Australia as part of the witness protection program. Thus a mad chase ensues as Fergus and Wesley head for the outback with immigration agents, secret service men and IRA renegades hot on their trail.

results.title: Dalekmania
results.creator_credit: Kevin Davies, John Farbrother and Amity Productions
results.brief_description: It’s 1965 in England: the BBC TV serial ‘Doctor Who’ is presently on every home TV. A 6 part Dalek adventure has just finished - Dalekmania is at it’s height. Milton Subotsky and Max J. Rosenberg competing against ‘Hammer Horror’, decide to cash in on the Dalekmania - they release their first Dalek movie : “Dr. Who and the Daleks”. No one had ever seen Daleks in colour, so in the wide-screen film, Daleks of all colours dominated the screen. Peter Cushing played the Doctor, unlike the TV serial. Although the film was separate from the BBC production - it was highly successful. So successful they made another movie : “Dalek - Invasion Earth 2150 A.D.”, a year later whilst Daleks were still on people’s minds. In this short film we see snippets and trailers from these two movies; hear interesting stories from the actors involved; and those wonderful toys and memorabilia that have become extremely collectable.
